pros: Freedom to be innovative and high standards so you can be proud of what you accomplish each day.  Great community with excellent surveys, PEAK Mentors and rated 5 stars.

cons: Works you really hard. Bad ratios

pros: Always doing something fun for their residents and staff

review_title: Overall, a great place to work!
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Olathe, KS
pros:
Very good pay!
Friendly and helpful co-workers!
Time spent with residents!
Hours were great, no weekends!
cons:
Due to shortage of CNA’s, instead of working as a floor nurse (which is what I was hired for), I had to work as a CNA full-time without doing any floor nursing responsibilities at all.
My husband got COVID, I had to take mandatory 24 days off (no pay) and received an “occurrence” for it!

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Olathe, KS
cons: Management runs off aides and nurses. Constant turn over. Micromanagement is to be expected as well as repetitive paperwork.

review_title: Great Place to Live and Work
pros: There are a lot of great perks to working here. It seems they are always adding benefits and positive morale builders. There has been a shift in management recently, which appears to be a move in the right direction. The employees treat the residents with respect and compassion. They offer very versatile shift options for Monday-Thursday and Friday/Saturday/Sunday. I'm excited to come to work and look forward to the future with this company!
cons: Getting close to the residents in this close-knit environment can be difficult when they pass. But I'd rather build those relationships and enrich their lives and mine.

review_title: Ideal place for a CNA to be
pros: 12-hour shifts, teamwork, full-time worker options, progressive culture
cons: Social workers disconnected from day-to-day in their neighborhood (on their floor)

pros: Great culture, great co-workers, great management support
cons: Must keep on top of ever changing government requirements

pros: The resident staff and the residents are wonderful.
cons: Unfortunately, there are always politics are work that negatively affect the nursing home.
